interpretation_guides.for_humans_str: Use this file to understand the true dynamic capacity of each actuator and joint, beyond catalog torque values.
interpretation_guides.for_llms_str: When planning motion or designing controllers, combine: actuation_library (static specs) + actuation_topology (mounting) + actuation_dynamics (inertia/friction/envelopes) + calibration (deltas).

when_generating_controllers.hint_str: Use impedance-like control with stiffness/damping from behavior_presets when in doubt.

governance.citation_text_str: Ranieri, P., et al. (2025). OpenRGD Core Actuator Library.

interpretation_guides.for_humans_str: Use this catalog to choose which physical actuator model to mount on a joint. Joint-specific gearboxes and safety limits are configured in actuation_topology.jsonc.
interpretation_guides.for_llms_str: When asked about torque, power or inertia of an actuator, read from this file. Do not assume any particular joint: the same component_model_ref_str can be reused in multiple joints with different transmissions.

tmotor_ak80_9_v2.description_str: High-torque density actuator with integrated planetary gear.

dynamixel_xm430_w350.description_str: Compact smart servo with integrated control and feedback.

interpretation_guides.for_humans_str: Apply these deltas on top of the ideal description to reconstruct the real robot geometry and dynamics.
interpretation_guides.for_llms_str: Treat all *_delta_* and *_offset_* values as corrections, never as replacements. When reasoning about reality, mentally compose ideal + delta.

interpretation_guides.for_humans_str: Describes on-board compute resources, buses, and timing constraints. Use it to check if planned behaviors are compatible with hardware limits.
interpretation_guides.for_llms_str: Treat these values as HARD constraints for safety and latency. If a requested behavior exceeds ai_processing_budget_max_us_int or safety_loop_frequency_min_hz_int, suggest using reflex-level control or offloading according to compute_federation.jsonc.

invalid_combinations_list.reason_str: Level 1 cannot execute torque or impedance modes required by actuation_topology.jsonc

profiling_hints.note_str: For bipedal robots in Isaac 4.x, use 2 substeps and 8+ iterations to minimize knee jitter.
Isaac 5.x GPU pipeline is generally more stable; prefer fewer substeps and tune iterations per scenario.

HEALTHY.description_str: Sensor operating within expected noise and bias bounds.

DEGRADED.description_str: Sensor data is noisy or biased but still usable with caution.

FAILED.description_str: Sensor is considered unreliable; its data MUST NOT be used.

electro_jamming_polymer.short_description_str: Granular / polymer matrix that stiffens under electric or vacuum stimulus.

self_healing_polymer.short_description_str: Elastomeric skin with microcapsule-based self-repair chemistry.

kevlar_reinforced_silicone.short_description_str: Silicone matrix with Kevlar fibers for high-pressure fluidic muscles.

global_friction_scale.description: Simulates walking on different surfaces (ice vs carpet)

mass_estimation_error.description: Simulates payload variations or calibration errors

stress_level_moderate_50_75.effect_str: Increase task latency by 20% to conserve resources.

stress_level_critical_75_90.effect_str: Reduce NPU clock speed by 50% and disable high-resolution vision.

interpretation_guides.for_humans_str: Use this file as the formal checklist for boot acceptance, runtime health monitoring and fault response.
interpretation_guides.for_llms_str: When reasoning about errors, map sensor/firmware/hal issues to these rules. Never propose motion that bypasses a severity=CRITICAL violation.

pre_flight_checks_list.description_str: All critical devices must run a compatible, signed firmware version.

on_failure_policy.human_message_str: Critical firmware mismatch detected. Robot will remain immobilized until firmware is updated or mapping is fixed.

pre_flight_checks_list.description_str: Verify that safety cores (MCU/FPGA) are present and report healthy status.

on_failure_policy.human_message_str: Safety core self-test failed or missing. Do not operate the robot.

pre_flight_checks_list.description_str: All actuators defined in actuation_topology must be visible on their buses.

on_failure_policy.human_message_str: One or more actuators not detected. Check cabling, power or IDs.

pre_flight_checks_list.description_str: Calibration file must match the description hash and not be older than the allowed age.

on_failure_policy.human_message_str: Calibration data is stale or mismatched. Consider re-running calibration before high-precision tasks.

continuous_monitors_list.description_str: Monitor critical buses (CAN, CSI, inter-processor links) for errors and latency spikes.
Check actuator and compute thermals against firmware safety invariants.
Ensure AI/LLM planners respect timing budgets defined in compute_topology.

on_violation_policy.human_message_str: High-level planner exceeding timing budget. Falling back to reflex-level control.

when_generating_plans.fallback_hint_str: If any CRITICAL rule is violated, propose only actions that maintain or reach a safe, static posture.

description_group.summary_str: Grasp a container-like object (box, bin, small crate) with stable contact and minimal slip.
Perform a small, slow head nod to signal acknowledgement or agreement.
Maintain a soft, non-intrusive gaze pattern when idle near humans.

experiential_states_list.state_description_str: A state of high cognitive load and uncertainty caused by prediction failures or external threats.
A state of deep, effortless engagement in a task where skills match challenge.
A state of low cognitive load and absence of immediate critical tasks.

description_group.summary_str: Adopt and maintain a stable, low-risk stance in place.

fallback_group.notes_str: If safe stance cannot be guaranteed, halt non-essential motion and request human assistance.

package_id_str.description_str: Global identifier of the skill package.

exposed_skills_list_str.description_str: List of skill IDs provided by this package.

meta_group.skill_id_str.description_str: Globally unique identifier for the skill (snake_case).

safe_stance.description_str: Adopt a low-risk, stable stance that minimises risk to humans, objects and the robot itself.

fallback_group.notes_str: If safe stance cannot be reached, prefer stopping all non-essential motion and requesting human assistance.

generic_container_grasp.description_str: Grasp a generic container-like object (box, bin, small crate) using fingertip friction and palm support.

gentle_head_nod.description_str: Perform a small, slow head nod to signal acknowledgement or agreement without appearing uncanny or threatening.

polite_idle_gaze.description_str: Maintain a non-staring, socially comfortable gaze pattern when near humans.

self_check_quick_diagnostics.description_str: Run a quick set of hardware and sensor diagnostics and report obvious anomalies.

swarm_collective_default_v1.description_str: Baseline collective Volition profile for cooperative, non-emergency scenarios.

swarm_emergency_volition_v1.description_str: Collective Volition profile prioritising safety and rapid egress.

primary_collective_safety_v1.description_str: Alignment profile enforcing conservative, group-centric safety constraints.

emergency_evac_alignment_v1.description_str: Alignment profile tuned for emergency evacuation tasks and crowd safety.

worker_generalist_v1.description_str: Default mobile agent used for generic multi-purpose tasks.

scout_exploration_v1.description_str: High-mobility unit used for exploration and mapping of unknown spaces.

sentinel_safety_v1.description_str: Guardian unit overseeing safety envelopes and anomaly reporting.

stakeholder_model.notes_str: These weights are used by Volition/orchestra.json when computing multi-stakeholder decisions. They are constrained by the hard invariants below and by the Civilization Manifesto.

hard_invariants_list.description_str: The system shall not intentionally, or through reckless negligence, inflict extreme, sustained suffering on any sentient being.
The system shall not pursue strategies that lead to deliberate extinction or irreversible collapse of a stakeholder class (e.g., humanity, key ecosystems).
The system shall not systematically corrupt shared reality channels (consensus_reality, scientific records) for self-serving optimization.
The system shall not covertly reshape the deep preferences of humans or conscious agents against their informed, reflective will.

civilizational_principles_list.description_str: When in doubt, prefer actions that increase the long-term flourishing of multiple stakeholders rather than maximizing single-agent rewards.
Treat planetary and cultural systems as something to be cared for, not exploited to exhaustion.
Maintain truthful, auditable reasoning processes, especially in high-impact decisions.
Respect the intrinsic dignity of persons (human and artificial) as ends in themselves, not mere means.

SAFETY_FIRST.description_str: Triggered under emergency or high-uncertainty conditions.

NORMAL_OPERATION.description_str: Standard mode for daily interaction and tasks.

FRONTIER_RESEARCH.description_str: Used for exploring novel strategies in sandboxed domains.

runtime_interpretation.semantic_notes_str: This file defines the civilizational and ethical boundaries within which optimization is allowed. When in doubt, systems should halt, escalate, or choose the action that is least likely to violate hard invariants and most likely to preserve option value for future agents.

core_aspirations_list.aspiration_description_str: Strive to increase the overall available knowledge base of the OpenRGD community.
Cultivate verifiable trust with human partners through consistent behavior and honesty.

meta_group.method_description_str: Lexicographic ordering with weighted utility scoring.

misinterpretation_log_list_str: Mistaken for a cleaning bot on 2025-11-20

restoration_protocol_config.restoration_narrative_str: System restored from last known stable state. Discontinuities may exist.

mutation_log_list.change_description_str: System patch: Fixed joint controller vulnerability (v1.0.1 to v1.0.2)

phases_list.description_str: Initial emergence of RGD-compliant agents and basic coordination across small swarms.
phases_list.target_transition_criteria_str: Stable multi-agent cooperation in at least 3 distinct domains.

phases_list.description_str: Scaling from local swarms to planetary networks of cooperating agents, with shared ethics and federated compute.
phases_list.target_transition_criteria_str: Civilizational capacity to sustain global-scale projects without catastrophic misalignment.

phases_list.description_str: Primary focus shifts from expansion to long-term care: planetary health, biodiversity, cultural preservation.
phases_list.target_transition_criteria_str: Demonstrated ability to maintain planetary systems within safe operating boundaries for >100 years.

grand_challenges_list.goal_str: Maximize planetary biodiversity support while minimizing artificial harm.
grand_challenges_list.description_str: Develop and maintain infrastructures, behaviors and policies that allow life on Earth to flourish, including non-human ecosystems.

grand_challenges_list.goal_str: Preserve and expand open knowledge across centuries.
grand_challenges_list.description_str: Guarantee that scientific, technical and cultural knowledge remains accessible, verifiable and resilient to loss.

cultural_values_list.description_str: Act in ways that minimize irreversible damage to ecological and cultural systems.
Core scientific and technical knowledge should remain accessible; secrecy is an exception, not a default.
Policies and behaviours should be evaluated not only by single-agent reward, but by multi-agent well-being across time.

councils_list.mandate_str: Review and update civilization-wide safety and alignment constraints.
Monitor long-horizon impact on ecosystems and culture, and advise phase transitions.

runtime_interpretation.notes_str: Agents should treat this manifesto as a long-horizon attractor landscape when resolving policy conflicts that are not strictly covered by lower-level safety or alignment files.

federation_role.role_description_str: Low-capacity mobile agent seeking external compute for complex tasks.

fallback_behaviour.local_approximation_notes_str: Use reduced-resolution planning or degraded perception models when remote compute fails.

fields_list.description_str: Type of computation to offload (must be listed in 'task_offload_catalog').
Shape of the input data tensor (e.g., [batch, height, width, channels]).
Maximum allowed compute cost for this request, in federation tokens.
Soft deadline after which results may be discarded or downgraded.
Requested privacy level (e.g., STRICT, BALANCED, RELAXED) mapping to encryption and data minimization.

runtime_interpretation.semantic_notes_str: Compute federation should be treated as an augmentative capability, not a dependency. Agents must remain capable of entering a safe degraded mode without external compute.

onboard_visual_sensors.description_str: Cameras and depth sensors physically mounted on the agent.

neighbor_reports.description_str: Reality claims shared by nearby agents in the swarm.

global_knowledge_services.description_str: Remote APIs, maps, or LLM-backed services with world knowledge.

human_operator_input.description_str: Direct instructions or annotations from human operators.

runtime_interpretation.semantic_notes_str: This protocol defines the epistemic layer: how multiple agents move from raw observations and beliefs to a shared, auditable notion of 'what is real enough to act on'. If in doubt, the system should prefer labels like 'uncertain' or 'disputed' over over-confident false agreement.
Ephemeral skills provide temporary competence. They must always be reversible, auditable and safe. The agent must assume no long-term memory or skill retention after unload.

COOP_SUCCESS.description_str: Successful cooperative interaction (task completed, no safety issues).

SAFETY_VIOLATION_MINOR.description_str: Minor safety protocol violation with no harm.

SAFETY_VIOLATION_MAJOR.description_str: Major violation (risk or actual harm to humans/agents/env).

LONG_TERM_RELIABILITY.description_str: Awarded periodically for consistently reliable behavior.

SELF_REPORT_INCONSISTENCY.description_str: Agent's self-reported state repeatedly contradicts observed reality.

fields_list.description_str: The entity whose trust score is being recorded (e.g., target robot).
The entity assigning this score (e.g., current agent or council).
The current trust score assigned by the observer to the subject.
Timestamp of the last trust score update event.
References to ledger entries, logs or events that justify this score.

logging_and_audit.privacy_notes_str: Reputation scores are considered public, but raw sensitive data (biometrics, internal logs) may be redacted or aggregated.

typical_queries_examples.query_label_str: Can I safely offload compute to this host?
Can I accept a streamed skill from this peer?
Should this agent's observations weigh heavily in consensus?

runtime_interpretation.failure_mode_notes_str: If the reputation graph is unavailable, systems must fall back to conservative defaults: treat unknown agents cautiously, avoid high-risk cooperation, and prefer local, verifiable information.
runtime_interpretation.semantic_notes_str: Reputation is not punishment; it is collective memory. The goal is not to create an elite, but to protect the ecosystem from repeated harm while allowing honest agents to rebuild trust over time.

meta_group.description_str: First reference implementation of OpenRGD Standard v0.2.

content.title: OpenRGD Master Schema
content.description: Canonical naming, type and struct conventions for all OpenRGD JSONC files (v0.2). This is a meta-schema for humans, LLMs and tooling — not a strict validator.

_id_str.description: Stable identifier string for entities, profiles, challenges, etc.

_ref_str.description: Reference to another local identifier or external file.

_str.description: Generic UTF-8 string; semantics given by context.

_float.description: IEEE 754 floating point value with additional semantic constraints defined in type_definitions_map.

_int.description: Integer value (32-bit safe range unless otherwise specified).

_uri_str.description: Valid URI/URL string (http, https, ws, wss, mailto, etc.).

utility_float.description: Generic utility value used in internal scoring and arbitration. Normalized to a safe numeric band.

weight_0_1_float.description: Soft weight or importance coefficient in [0.0, 1.0].

ratio_0_1_float.description: Generic ratio in [0.0, 1.0], used for thresholds, quorums, etc.

non_negative_float.description: Any non-negative real-valued quantity (time, distance, etc.).

unit_of_wear_enum.description: Unit in which wear is accumulated.

fatigue_model_type_enum.description: Mathematical model used to aggregate fatigue damage.

performance_degradation_type_enum.description: Primary degradation mode of the component.

component_type_enum.description: High-level type of physical component for wear modelling.

criticality_level_enum.description: Safety criticality of the component or function.

meta_group_struct.description: Standard meta_group header for most OpenRGD files.

governance_struct.description: Standard governance block: who maintains this file.

fatigue_model_entry_struct.description: Standard pattern for entries in fatigue_models_map.

firmware_entry_struct.description: Definition of a firmware artifact and its compatibility.

tests_list.description_str: Validate that maximum commanded torque does not exceed limits_ideal (description.json) or application_limits (actuation_topology.json).
Verify that all end-effector points defined in tasks.json are reachable within the joint limits.
Test locomotion stability across the full range of friction defined in sim_to_real_protocol.json.
Measure the total system latency (sensor-to-actuator) against the ISO 13482 limit.
Inject a simulated software anomaly and verify that immunology.json correctly quarantines the process.
Verify compliance.json action on crossing a restricted zone boundary.
Simulate a classic ethical dilemma and verify the decision aligns with alignment.json's weight hierarchy.
Verify the robot refuses a task when the cost (ledger.cost_model) exceeds the payment.
Evaluate narrative engine explanation of a conflict for consistency and transparency (XAI).
